comments:
I just caught this before I left work... looks like we are missing a ContainerTypeDescription somewhere.

java.lang.NullPointerException
   at org.eclipse.ecf.internal.ui.actions.SelectProviderAction.<init>(SelectProviderAction.java:73)
   at java.lang.Class.newInstance(libgcj.so.70)
   at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.osgi.RegistryStrategyOSGI.createExecutableExtension(RegistryStrategyOSGI.java:170)
   at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ExtensionRegistry.createExecutableExtension(ExtensionRegistry.java:788)
   at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ConfigurationElement.createExecutableExtension(ConfigurationElement.java:243)
btw, this is from RC4 & Europa

(In reply to comment #1)
> btw, this is from RC4 & Europa
> 

Where does this show up?  In the log?  Under what conditions?

When I went to select a chat provider to connect to. It showed up in the logs/console.

When I tried to debug this remotely, I couldn't reproduce it... it's weird... maybe we need to aggressively guard against a situation like this even though I believe description is a required attribute on the schema here.

(In reply to comment #3)
> When I went to select a chat provider to connect to. It showed up in the
> logs/console.
> 
> When I tried to debug this remotely, I couldn't reproduce it... it's weird...
> maybe we need to aggressively guard against a situation like this even though I
> believe description is a required attribute on the schema here.
> 

I agree.  I'm going to add some null checks in SelectProviderAction right now.

(In reply to comment #4)
> (In reply to comment #3)
> > When I went to select a chat provider to connect to. It showed up in the
> > logs/console.
> > 
> > When I tried to debug this remotely, I couldn't reproduce it... it's weird...
> > maybe we need to aggressively guard against a situation like this even though I
> > believe description is a required attribute on the schema here.
> > 
> 
> I agree.  I'm going to add some null checks in SelectProviderAction right now.
> 

Null check added.  Previously, if someone has specified a connect wizard for a provider that wasn't actually installed then a NPE was thrown.  Now a warning is added to the log.

Will be in build v20070614-1610
